title: Amia and the Lost Sunbeam
hook: In the heart of the great Fora jungle, a gentle-hearted flower fairy named Amia lived peacefully. But one sunny day, something unexpected happened...
moral: Kindness and determination can brighten even the darkest paths.
paragraphs: One sunny morning, Amia was fluttering through the jungle, spreading her magical flower dust, when she noticed something odd. The bright sunbeam that always shone through the trees was missing, casting shadows where there should have been light.

"Oh no, where did the sunbeam go?" exclaimed Amia, her wings fluttering with worry. She followed the shadows to a dense thicket, where she found a mischievous monkey playing with a shiny glass orb that had trapped the sunbeam inside.

"Mr. Monkey, would you please let the sunbeam out? The flowers need its warmth to bloom," Amia asked kindly. The monkey scowled, reluctant to give up his new toy. But with a gentle smile and a sprinkle of flower dust, Amia persuaded him to release the sunbeam back into the sky.

As the sunbeam returned to its rightful place, the jungle was once again filled with light and warmth. The flowers bloomed brighter than ever, and the monkey learned that sharing kindness brings more joy than keeping things for oneself.

en-de.title: Amia und der Verlorene Sonnenstrahl
en-de.moral: Freundlichkeit und Entschlossenheit können selbst die dunkelsten Wege erhellen.
en-de.hook: Im Herzen vom großen Fora Dschungel lebte friedlich eine sanftmütige Blumenfee namens Amia. Doch eines sonnigen Tages geschah etwas Unerwartetes...
paragraphs:
An einem sonnigen Morgen flatterte Amia durch den Dschungel und verteilte ihren magischen Blumenstaub. Dabei fiel ihr etwas Merkwürdiges auf. Der helle Sonnenstrahl, der immer durch die Bäume schien, fehlte plötzlich und warf Schatten an Stellen, wo eigentlich Licht sein sollte.
"Oh nein, wo ist der Sonnenstrahl hingegangen?" rief Amia aus, während ihre Flügel vor Sorge flatterten. Sie folgte den Schatten zu einem dichten Gebüsch, wo sie einen spitzbübischen Affen fand, der mit einer glänzenden Glaskugel spielte, in der der Sonnenstrahl gefangen war.
"Herr Affe, könntest du bitte den Sonnenstrahl herauslassen? Die Blumen brauchen seine Wärme, um zu blühen", bat Amia freundlich. Der Affe runzelte die Stirn, unwillig, sein neues Spielzeug aufzugeben. Aber mit einem sanften Lächeln und einer Prise Blumenduft überzeugte Amia ihn, den Sonnenstrahl wieder in den Himmel zu lassen.
Als der Sonnenstrahl an seinen rechtmäßigen Platz zurückkehrte, war der Dschungel wieder voller Licht und Wärme. Die Blumen blühten heller als je zuvor, und der Affe lernte, dass das Teilen von Freundlichkeit mehr Freude bringt als das Behalten von Dingen für sich.

en-fr.title: Petite Amia et le Rayon de Soleil Perdu
en-fr.moral: La gentillesse et la détermination peuvent éclairer même les chemins les plus sombres.
en-fr.hook: Au coeur de la grande jungle de Fora, une gentille fée des fleurs nommée Amia vivait paisiblement. Mais un jour ensoleillé, quelque chose d'inattendu est arrivé...
paragraphs:
Un matin ensoleillé, Amia volait à travers la jungle, répandant sa poudre de fleurs magique, quand elle a remarqué quelque chose d'étrange. Le rayon de soleil brillant qui brillait toujours à travers les arbres manquait, projetant des ombres là où il aurait dû y avoir de la lumière.
"Oh non, où est passé le rayon de soleil?" s'écria Amia, ses ailes battant avec inquiétude. Elle suivit les ombres jusqu'à un fourré dense, où elle trouva un singe malicieux jouant avec un bel orbe de verre qui avait piégé le rayon de soleil à l'intérieur.
Mr. Monkey, peux-tu s'il te plaît laisser sortir le rayon de soleil? Les fleurs ont besoin de sa chaleur pour éclore," demanda gentiment Amia. Le singe fit la grimace, réticent à abandonner son nouveau jouet. Mais avec un doux sourire et une pincée de poussière de fleur, Amia le persuada de laisser le rayon de soleil retourner dans le ciel.
Quand le rayon de soleil est rentré à sa place légitime, la jungle a été de nouveau remplie de lumière et de chaleur. Les fleurs ont fleuri encore plus brillamment, et le singe a appris que partager la gentillesse apporte plus de joie que garder les choses pour soi.

en-pt.title: Amia e o Raio de Sol Perdido
en-pt.moral: Ser gentil e determinado pode iluminar até mesmo os caminhos mais escuros.
en-pt.hook: No coração da grande floresta de Fora, vivia pacificamente uma fada das flores de coração amável chamada Amia. Mas num dia ensolarado, algo inesperado aconteceu...
paragraphs:
Num ensolarado manhã, Amia estava voando pela floresta, espalhando sua poeira mágica de flores, quando percebeu algo estranho. O raio de sol brilhante que sempre brilhava pelas árvores estava faltando, lançando sombras onde deveria haver luz.
Oh não, para onde foi o raio de sol? exclamou Amia, suas asas batendo com preocupação. Ela seguiu as sombras até um matagal denso, onde encontrou um macaco travesso brincando com uma esfera de vidro brilhante que havia aprisionado o raio de sol dentro.
Sr. Macaco, você poderia por favor liberar o raio de sol? As flores precisam do seu calor para florescer," Amia perguntou gentilmente. O macaco fez uma cara feia, relutante em largar seu novo brinquedo. Mas com um sorriso gentil e um pouquinho de pó de flor, Amia o persuadiu a devolver o raio de sol de volta para o céu.
Quando o raio de sol voltou para o seu lugar certo, a floresta ficou cheia de luz e calor novamente. As flores floresceram mais brilhantes do que nunca, e o macaco aprendeu que compartilhar bondade traz mais alegria do que guardar coisas para si mesmo.

id-en.hook: In the heart of the great Fora jungle, a gentle-hearted flower fairy named Amia lived peacefully. But one sunny day, something unexpected happened...
id-en.moral: Kindness and determination can brighten even the darkest paths.
id-en.title: Amia and the Lost Sunbeam
paragraphs:
Once upon a time, under the warm sun, Amia was flying in the jungle, sprinkling her special flower powder, when she saw something strange. The big sunray that usually came through the trees was not there, making darkness where it should be bright.
"Oh no, where did the sunbeam go?" said Amia with concern. She saw a cheeky monkey in the bushes, holding a shiny glass ball that had caught the sunbeam.
Amia asked Mr. Monkey nicely to share the sunshine with the flowers. Although the monkey was unhappy, Amia's friendly approach convinced him to free the sunbeam.
Once the sunshine came back to where it belonged, the forest got bright and cozy again. The pretty flowers blossomed even more, and the monkey found out that being nice to others makes us happier than keeping everything to ourselves.
